events.originalText: The Italian cruise ship Costa Concordia ran aground on a reef and capsized off Isola del Giglio, Tuscany.
events.subtitle: Costa Concordia
events.headline: Costa Concordia cruise ship capsizes off Isola del Giglio, Tuscany

events.originalText: The first of two large earthquakes struck El Salvador, killing at least 944 people and destroying over 100,000 homes.
events.subtitle: January 2001 El Salvador earthquake
events.headline: First earthquake in El Salvador kills 944, destroys 100,000 homes

events.originalText: Steve Ballmer replaced Bill Gates as the chief executive officer of Microsoft.
events.subtitle: Steve Ballmer
events.headline: Steve Ballmer replaces Bill Gates as Microsoft CEO

events.originalText: Bernice Gera won a sex-discrimination lawsuit against the National Association of Professional Baseball Leagues, allowing her to become the first female professional baseball umpire.
events.subtitle: Bernice Gera
events.headline: Bernice Gera wins sex-discrimination lawsuit, becomes first female baseball umpire

events.originalText: Ghanaian military officer Ignatius Kutu Acheampong led a coup to overthrow Prime Minister Kofi Abrefa Busia and President Edward Akufo-Addo.
events.subtitle: Ignatius Kutu Acheampong
events.headline: Ghanaian military officer leads coup to overthrow Prime Minister and President

events.originalText: American singer Johnny Cash recorded his landmark album At Folsom Prison live at Folsom Prison in California.
events.subtitle: Johnny Cash
events.headline: Johnny Cash records landmark album At Folsom Prison live in California

events.originalText: Togo's first president, Sylvanus Olympio (pictured), was assassinated by military officers in a coup d'état led by Emmanuel Bodjollé, Étienne Eyadéma, and Kléber Dadjo.
events.subtitle: Sylvanus Olympio
events.headline: Togo's first president Sylvanus Olympio assassinated in coup d'état

events.originalText: Nine Moscow doctors were accused of a plot to poison members of the Soviet political and military leadership.
events.subtitle: Doctors' plot
events.headline: Nine Moscow doctors accused of plot to poison Soviet leadership

events.originalText: About 30,000 people were killed when an earthquake struck the Province of L'Aquila in Italy.
events.subtitle: 1915 Avezzano earthquake
events.headline: 30,000 killed in earthquake in Province of L'Aquila, Italy

events.originalText: Welsh physician William Price (pictured) was arrested for attempting to cremate his deceased infant son; this eventually led to the United Kingdom cremation act becoming law.
events.subtitle: William Price (physician)
events.headline: Welsh physician William Price arrested for attempting to cremate son

events.originalText: The Treaty of Cahuenga was signed, informally ending the fighting of the Mexican–American War in California.
events.subtitle: Treaty of Cahuenga
events.headline: Treaty of Cahuenga signed, ending Mexican–American War in California

events.originalText: First Anglo-Afghan War: William Brydon, an assistant surgeon in the British Army, was the sole European of the 14,000 people retreating from Kabul to Jalalabad who evaded capture or death.
events.subtitle: First Anglo-Afghan War
events.headline: William Brydon sole European to evade capture in First Anglo-Afghan War retreat

events.originalText: War of 1812: British troops captured Fort Peter in St. Marys, Georgia, in the only battle of the war to take place in the state.
events.subtitle: War of 1812
events.headline: British troops capture Fort Peter in St. Marys, Georgia during War of 1812

events.originalText: French Revolutionary Wars: A naval battle off the coast of Brittany between two British frigates and a French ship of the line ended with hundreds of deaths when the latter ran aground.
events.subtitle: French Revolutionary Wars
events.headline: Naval battle off Brittany coast ends with hundreds dead

events.originalText: Pope Eugene IV promulgated the papal bull Sicut dudum, forbidding the enslavement of the native Guanche of the Canary Islands by the Spanish.
events.subtitle: Pope Eugene IV
events.headline: Pope Eugene IV forbids enslavement of native Guanche of Canary Islands
